title: Head of the Charles won’t be affected by bacteria bloom, officials say
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News City health officials expanded a Charles River health advisory as cyanobacteria bloom intensifies — but Regatta rowers will be in the clear.
The Head of the Charles Regatta is proceeding as planned this weekend despite a growing toxic algae bloom in the Charles River, health officials announced.
A cyanobacteria public health advisory along the Charles River has expanded to include all areas downstream of the Cambridge Street Bridge, according to an update released Thursday on Boston.

title: NFL insider proposes trade between Patriots and Texans involving Kyle Dugger
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: New England Patriots A change of scenery could benefit the two players in the suggested swap.
Kyle Dugger signed a four-year, $58 million contract extension with the Jerod Mayo-led Patriots in April 2024.
AP Photo/Greg M.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now

title: Patriots injury report: Stefon Diggs (chest) questionable to play vs. Titans
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: New England Patriots Diggs was a full participant in New England’s final practice on Friday before the team travels to Tennessee.

title: Jaylen Brown’s status for Celtics’ season opener unclear, but considered day-to-day
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Celtics Brown left the Celtics' preseason finale early due to a hamstring injury.
Jaylen Brown didn't appear to suffer a long-term injury in the Celtics' preseason finale.

(AP Photo/Charles Krupa) By Conor Roche October 17, 2025 | 4:45 PM 2 minutes to read Jaylen Brown wasn’t a full participant at the Celtics’ first practice after he injured his hamstring in Wednesday’s preseason finale, but the team doesn’t seem too concerned about his health.

title: BPD releases photos of alleged strong-arm charity scammers
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Boston police say there have been 11 reported incidents locally, totaling $170,700 in losses.

By Abby Patkin October 17, 2025 | 4:18 PM 1 minute to read Boston police are warning about a series of fraudulent charity scams after several women said they were fleeced for donations and strong-armed into thousands of dollars in unauthorized charges.
In a news release Thursday, the Boston Police Department said there have been 11 reported incidents locally, totaling $170,700 in losses.

title: 5 ways for Red Sox to replace Alex Bregman at 3B if he leaves in free agency
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Red Sox There are a handful of ways the Red Sox could replace Bregman if they lose him in free agency.
Eugenio Suarez is the top third base option in free agency this offseason after Alex Bregman.

(AP Photo/Lindsey Wasson) By Conor Roche October 17, 2025 | 4:13 PM 4 minutes to read After having too many third basemen at the start of spring training, the Red Sox might have the opposite problem this offseason.

title: How one Mass. coffee shop is protesting Trump in lieu of No Kings
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Local News More than 250 years ago, protesters dumped tea into the Boston Harbor.
On Saturday, an Ayer coffee shop is allowing customers to pour it into the streets.
Markoh's Wake and Bake cafe is hosting a "Boston Tea Party" to protest the Trump administration.

title: How Portland is celebrating the 100th anniversary of this iconic clock
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel The rare four-dial street clock, installed in 1925, has been fully restored.
The before and after photos of the renovated 100 year-old Hay & Peabody Seth Thomas Clock in Portland, Maine.

title: Feds say Everett ‘notified’ them of 13-year-old’s arrest as mayor denies city called ICE
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News The Department of Homeland Security said the boy has ties to a Brazilian crime ring and has racked up a string of charges in Massachusetts.
Demonstrators protest during a rally outside Everett City Hall after a 13-year-old boy was arrested by Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents in Everett.
